intro: Nerine × stricklandii, commonly known as the hybrid nerine, is a bulbous perennial plant native to South Africa. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple, typically blooming in late summer to early autumn. The plant has strap-like, grassy leaves that are evergreen in mild climates and die back in colder regions. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting flowers and ease of cultivation.
